intro: Dactylanthes anacantha, commonly known as the spiny devil's backbone, is a member of the Apocynaceae family. It is a perennial shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central column. Dactylanthes anacantha is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability.
